question.text: Which of the following statements is true according to the concept of biological classification?

options.text: Bacteria are heterotrophic saprophytic organisms in the kingdom Monera with a great range of diversity.
The heterotrophic prokaryotic, multicellular organisms lacking a cell wall are included in kingdom Animalia.
Kingdom Fungi includes eukaryotic, multicellular heterotrophic organisms which exhibit both sexual as well as asexual modes of reproduction and have a great range of diversity.
Kingdom Plantae includes eukaryotic chlorophyll containing unicellular organisms and a few heterotrophs.

solution.text: Bacteria may be autotrophic or heterotrophic organisms with a wide range of diversity present in the kingdom Monera. Members of kingdom Fungi are heterotrophic, eukaryotic, multicellular organism with cell wall made of chitin and exhibit both sexual as well as asexual modes of reproduction. Organisms present in kingdom Animalia are eukaryotic, multicellular, and heterotrophic with no cell wall. Kingdom Plantae consists of eukaryotic chlorophyll containing organisms with few heterotrophs.
